job.title: Site Reliability Engineer
job.description: Position: Site Reliability Engineer<br>Location: Remote<br>Job Type: 12 Months<br><br>Job Responsibilities:<br>• Work in a cross-functional team to design and implement the next generation of CI/CD<br>• platform as a service in-house product.<br>• Leverage Kubernetes operators, Tekton and Spinnaker pipelines to automate the<br>• deployment and administration of applications across multiple environments on-prem<br>• and in the cloud.<br>• Define workflows and processes to meet Infrastructure-as-Code objectives.<br>• Actively facilitate continuous improvement.<br>• Monitor various systems capacity and health indicators and trends.<br>• Provide 24x7 tier-3 troubleshooting and break-fix support for production services.<br>• Design and build RESTful microservices enabling the application of role-based access<br>• control, network policies, and service registration.<br><br>Required Qualifications:<br>• 2-5 years of relevant work experience.<br>• Strong software engineering skills, preferably working in multiple programming<br>• languages (Java, Go, Python).<br>• Proficiency in cloud-native technologies and architectures (Docker, Kubernetes,<br>• OpenShift).<br>• Proficiency in revision control and DevOps best practices (Git).<br>• Expert Linux experience (Red Hat, CentOS).<br><br>Preferred Qualifications:<br>• Experience with public or private cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud,<br>• OpenStack).<br>• Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment tools and platforms (Spinnaker,<br>• Drone, Jenkins, Ansible).<br>• Familiarity with Application Performance Monitoring (APM or tracing)<br>• Contributions to open-source projects.<br><br>Regards,<br>Justeen<br>Technical Recruiter<br>VDart Inc<br>Email: Justeen.d@vdartinc.com<br>
